intro: Gingidia haematitica, commonly known as the bloodroot or red-root plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange roots and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its roots contain various alkaloids and are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. However, it is also considered toxic and should be handled with care.
